website_summaries.verdict: AMD's new flagship desktop processor, the Ryzen 7 1800X, brings highly multithreaded performance into the mainstream for the first time—at a price of just $499.
cons: Requires use of a discrete graphics card
Single-core performance lags that of Intel Kaby Lake chips

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Huge improvement over my FX8350 for rendering and 4k editing. Partnered with a GTX 1080 its a real beast for gaming and editing. No issues what so ever
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: The most powerful CPU I have ever owned. Been team Intel ever since I've owned a PC. But this CPU is amazing at multitasking and great for gaming. I have it in an Asus PRIME X370-PRO and 16gb Corsair LPX Ram. It has eaten through everything I have thrown at it.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Coming from a 2500k is like being able to breathe again
customer_reviews.text: Absolute beast of a CPU. Coming from a 2500k is like being able to breathe again. I was struggling to game and watch something on my second monitor with everything else possible closed. With this CPU and 16GB RAM I don't even bother thinking about closing programs to free up power. This (or the 1700, 1700x or 1800) will do a dozen things at the same time and not slow down.
customer_reviews.author: Bix

customer_reviews.title: Amazing power at a very low price!
customer_reviews.text: Impressive performance at a great price. These were the main reasons that led me to choose AMD processors. If you compare the RYZEN 7 1800X with some other processors Intel that are available in the market you get a better price/performance ratio. I know that I could count with an amazing performance, but the most important aspects that really surprise me were, heating and energy consumption. The processor is a lot colder that the last generation of AMD and even than many similar Intel processors, and spends in some cases half the energy that the old FX series.
customer_reviews.author: André Fojo

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cpu a few months ago because I didn't want to have to upgrade my motherboard to get a 2700 as had originally planned. I do regret that decision but only because it would be better future proofing. I currently have this cpu over clocked to 4ghz on air cooling and it runs at acceptable temps, it runs everything I throw at it without issue except a little slow down when streaming cemu games in 4k through my shield to my TV but I think that's more my cemu config than cpu deficiencies. Great cpu, particularly now its dropping in price.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Hunt

customer_reviews.title: AMD Ryzen 7 1800X. A superb 8 core, 16 thread Central Processor.
customer_reviews.text: AMD Ryzen 7 1800X. It is great to have a truly fast CPU in a system with plenty of memory. This CPU handles 64GB of DDR4 RAM, which is what we have installed. It works very well and with water-cooling does not get even warm most of the time and that is at 3,600 MHz. We are pleased we chose this model, it is a superb processor, AMD have once more at least caught up with Intel, and at a more reasonable price. 16 processing threads allow serious virtual computing, in excess of the number of guest operating system we are ever likely to need. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ron L.

customer_reviews.title: Good Processor, Value for Money
customer_reviews.text: Capable of close to top end gaming (being used during end of 2018) This part is the bottleneck of my current PC, so is the perfect system to push this processor in its maximum paces. Runs ARMA3 PUBG, City Skylines, Planet Coaster, Wreckfest all on top settings with plenty going on. Running with a 1080ti GTX, 32gb 3200mhz RAM and installs all on SSD's. Apparently this is overclock able and I haven't even looked into needing it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan

customer_reviews.title: Superfast rendering
customer_reviews.text: Obviously awesome. Upgraded from an FX 8350 Which was the best cpu for value, and now, this one overtakes it. I edit videos, build games and play games, so I have this combined with a GTX 970 and corsair LPX ram 2x16GB. I haven't experemented much with it yet, but I can't wait to emulate old games on this for sure. I would just like to say though - I wouldn't bother with a CPU like this just yet if all you do is game, that is, if you're not willing to spend £300 on it.
customer_reviews.author: Flat pack orderer

customer_reviews.title: Value without question.
customer_reviews.text: Theres no dispute of the value on offer here. Be warned though, that if you want max FPS from your graphics card, intel chips are the best. That said you will be paying double for the extra 10% of a similar intel chip, if not more. Highly recommended. You will be unlikely to get a stable clock past 3.9Ghz. I achieved 4.1GHZ but scaled all the way back due to instability.
customer_reviews.author: Traygar 2001 est ebay

customer_reviews.title: Best processor I've owned so far
customer_reviews.text: Best processor I've owned so far. The first one was faulty under Linux (with a known early factory batch error). RMA gave me a new one and no faults so far.
customer_reviews.author: User

customer_reviews.title: You vs the guy she told you not to worry about
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding CPU, I was an intel fan boy, gave ryzen a try on a second machine and ended up selling my 8th gen intel system and keeping the Ryzen setup!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Wyles

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Monster
customer_reviews.text: Working with this CPU has been a real blast. I work with a lot of audio / video content and the performance gains over my old CPU have tippled. It works good in audio production (despite lacking singe core performance) I probably wouldn't recommenced it for pro audio workstation (by pro, I mean people with huge studios who make good money in audio). However, for content creation, encoding, rendering etc... this thing is amazing. It crushes most things you throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: PoundSound

customer_reviews.title: Very Stable
customer_reviews.text: Have paired this with an ~Asus Stryx motherboard and once board had updated, it has been very stable. I have more raw power than I will ever need for quite a awhile
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant processor
customer_reviews.text: I love this processor. I am so pleased to have got one. Even though people are slating this beauty it performs better and runs my pc perfect. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Nemas

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: great performance! Had a little problems with optimizing,but after all done is - perfect! Games,3D modelling all six points of 5 ^_^
customer_reviews.author: Jevgenijs Veinbergs

customer_reviews.title: Absolute beast of a processor. I moved from an ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolute beast of a processor. I moved from an FX-4300 to this... safe to say I have no regrets. I now have twice.. maybe even 3 times as many things running on my PC at the same time, but also not forgetting the performance within games has been boosted massively. Currently running at stock settings but will be overclocking in the near future!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The fastest PC I have ever built I would recommend Ryzen to anyone super fast smooth
customer_reviews.text: The fastest PC I have ever built I would recommend Ryzen to anyone super fast smooth
customer_reviews.author: B. Young

customer_reviews.title: Very good CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Really good processor for the price. I can game and record 1080p video whilst only using around 45% of the CPU. This thing also renders videos in no time at all. Going from an I5 4690K and I can really tell the difference!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Good cpu
customer_reviews.text: Its really good for multi tasking, rendering , streaming and playing games. Even though an intel cpu is better for games (higher fps) this one works perfectly for streaming while gaming .
customer_reviews.author: theophylaktos

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU
customer_reviews.text: Works well, easily installed without hassle. So far has handled all I have thrown at it. I have not attempted to overclock, no real need and I don't want the hassle of extra cooling etc.Four stars given as I cannot comment yet on long term use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, no issues, world as expected
customer_reviews.text: Good value for money, a great choice for high end gamers, I chose this due to my board only supporting 1st gen without a bios update
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Good all rounder
customer_reviews.text: Does everything well from browsing to gaming and for half the price of intel chips
customer_reviews.author: Michael Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Great Processor from AMD
customer_reviews.text: NO FAN for a fine processor! Easy to miss this on the small print and catches you out.
customer_reviews.author: Retired ITguy

customer_reviews.title: more cores than i need but i am not complaining
customer_reviews.text: masive jump in performance 7850k to a 1800x massive leap cant complain
customer_reviews.author: mp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No need to overclock runs everything ultra settings with my gtx1080ti except deus ex
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Fast CPU good for gaming but does not come with a fan so be sure to order one of those as well
customer_reviews.author: derpybookshelf

customer_reviews.title: Excellent seller.. recommended to all
customer_reviews.text: Excellent item... well impressed with unit and price... fair play pal.. well cheaper than what I nearly paid 😰
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This CPU is amazing AMD have really come back with a bang.
customer_reviews.author: Sable S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good CPU. Can run games at 1080p 60fps. Good at Streaming/Recording on OBS.
customer_reviews.author: Aidan Spence

customer_reviews.title: Fast, compatible and reliable. Much better value than Intel
customer_reviews.text: Yes you could buy a 1700 and overclock it, though you don't know how fast that will run. I picked the 1800X on the theory its better quality silicon and prefer to stick near the official clock speed for reliability. The high thread count really comes into it's own for work. As a developer running lots of tasks locally, using docker etc, a higher thread count is ideal. I switched from Xeon to Ryzen and have noticed no difference in reliability and no issues with compatibility. The only thing around that's any better is Threadripper which is so much more money and is 2 of these stuck together and do you REALLY need THAT many threads?
customer_reviews.author: Zac Tolley

customer_reviews.title: I simply cannot express how amazing this is
customer_reviews.text: This processor is a powerhouse. I simply cannot express how amazing this is. I have upgraded from an I5 4970k, not only does this processor beat my old on gaming performance, but it also makes any form of multitasking on my machine a dream. I do not get ANY stutters on any of my games, no matter what I am doing. Honestly this is amazing. I will update my review in the future if I have any issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: Sagetbh

customer_reviews.title: DAM SON
customer_reviews.text: love this cpu its a beast well worth it. half the cost of intel for same performance how can u not love it.
customer_reviews.author: dpb

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I got this after returning an Intel 8700k. This gives a Cinebench score of over 1600 - the Intel doesn't come close! Forget the Meltdown fiasco, this is better than Stock Intel by a considerable margin, despite being 6 months older, and cheaper!
customer_reviews.author: Viren T.

customer_reviews.title: love this processor well worth the money i was going ...
customer_reviews.text: love this processor well worth the money i was going to buy the i7 7700k but i wanted to livestream with better quality so i choose this ryzen 7 1800x and havent looked back you have outdone yourself with this processor amd
customer_reviews.author: graham

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: if your are an Amd fan this is a must , but not for this Intel fanboy
customer_reviews.author: dodgy1

customer_reviews.title: THERMAL PASTE IN PINS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on the 17th of June to put into my first build today to find out it had thermal paste in the pins preventing it from working and no idea how to return or get it sorted do not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Chris waddy

customer_reviews.title: Ryzen has risen.
customer_reviews.text: In 30 years of working with computers this is without any doubt the fastest cpu I have set my eyes on. Windows 10 installed in less than five minutes..
customer_reviews.author: p drake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Up till now it's good! But it's still got away to go with ram and xmp profiles.
customer_reviews.author: MR M

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly and very quick
customer_reviews.text: Swapped out of an i7 47690k as my son wanted it and I felt like a change. Can't fault this CPU. And the price point and motherboard I managed to get (not from amazon) made this a cheap upgrade for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pentest_UK

customer_reviews.title: definitely recommend this for future builds especially those that work with ...
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful production CPU, but also a decent gamers CPU may not compete with the 7700k on many games (though its barely behind) it outpaces many of intels flagship twice the price Processors, definitely recommend this for future builds especially those that work with videos/photos/graphics.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Mep

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed with ryzen
customer_reviews.text: very disappointed with ryzen, I had a 7700k setup but decided to try the new amd system. overall it was a bad choice, paired with a crosshair 6, first off there are many many bugs with the bios, ram doesn't run at rated xmp speeds (3600 kit maxed at 2666 even with new beta bios) gaming performance is a horrible stuttery mess, I mostly play the division and rainbow six siege, and aside from losing fps overall (144hz monitor with a titan Xp) about 15-20fps in most titles, I get stutters in most games. in general this has just been (to me) another disappointment from AMD.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great cpu from AMD but if you want similar performance ...
customer_reviews.text: A great cpu from AMD but if you want similar performance for a little cheaper get the 1700 or 1700x, they clock just as high and one even comes with a decent cooler! This cpu replaced my old FX-9370 clocked at 5ghz and I have to say the difference is night and day, great at multitasking, gaming, and video editing, I paired it with the Asus Crosshair VI Hero and the only issue I ran into was ram speed but that was fixed relatively quickly with a bios update. Would recommend this cpu to anyone who's looking for a good upgrade for an old system.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Strong Processor for gaming!
customer_reviews.text: For Christmas presents, I built 4 identical computers for myself, wife, and 2 boys to play games on. 4 out of 4 of these are all running effortlessly in our computers. I was watching my usage data, using MSI Afterburner, on different games with all settings maxed out. It was not even close to bottlenecking my GTX 1080. One game had the GTX 1080 running at 90%+, while this processor was only running at 50% of it's capacity. AMD is back in the game!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Beck

customer_reviews.title: Huge speed increase. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.text: A huge step up in speed for me, and makes compiling large projects painless, but instability (system hangs) forced me to upgrade my Ubuntu kernel from 4.3 to 4.10, and then eventually I just upgraded Ubuntu to 17.10. Now everything's stable. You can search the web for "ryzen-test-master.zip" to find a script that will max out the cores and exhibit the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: After stability issues, fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the people posting one star reviews on all the Ryzen products complaining about Intel and AMD "fanboys" are pathetically hilarious. Second, I picked this because it's Passmark to cost ratio was fantastic. I paired it with an AS Rock Taichi board for an Unraid server build. Initially I had stability issues, but that was mostly fixed by changing the c state settings in the BIOS. Performance has been stellar. I have run a couple instances of Plex transcoding and a virtual machine with GPU passthrough with plenty left on the table. Stability issues are annoying, but I'd definitely buy again over other available products for another server build.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Performance!
customer_reviews.text: Picked this beast up for 240 in 2018. About a year after it's launch and oh boy do I not regret it. How can anyone justify going with Intel when ryzen gives so much more price to performance? No fan boy here just saying. I'd go with blue team if they actually had a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: christopher

customer_reviews.title: CPU is a beast
customer_reviews.text: I got this before the 3950 had even been mentioned, so at the time it was king back in October 2019. Though today it is still in the top 5 processors for consumer use. Destroys any workload thrown at it, hits and stays at boost with good cooling. I would recommend it to anyone who games, does CAD, Modeling, Animation or just likes to drive a bunch of monitors with a lot of things open. With 32GB of ram and 4 monitors I've never even came close to taxing this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Andruff

customer_reviews.title: Go Red Team
customer_reviews.text: Love AMD affordable and powerful just had to wait 15 years for them to come out with another good one that I would buy. It's also good to see Globalfoundries is selling semiconductors to the public now and not just to the government and colleges for research. Now from what I'm hearing there coming out with a 7nm process chip but what I've heard 4 or 5 years ago was there were having problems with 5nm pocess chips so if this is true there way ahead of anything intel has.
customer_reviews.author: Nathaniel J. Derway

customer_reviews.title: It's been a great CPU.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this processor since May of 2017. Its been running basically 24/7 often under very heavy usage and it's yet to let me down. I had one AIO liquid cooler fail and the processor shut its self down when it encountered the thermal event. I replaced the AIO with a Corsair unit and its been rock solid even after running hot. There are better AMD processors out now but if you can get a deal on these I would still recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best 16 threads you will ever get at this price
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a BEAST! Fantastic price point, especially for 16 threads. I can game, watch a video, render a video project, and work in Excell all at the same time on this thing. This can do more at the same time than I could have imagined.
customer_reviews.author: T.J

customer_reviews.title: No Reason Not To Have This Beast!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor, I never expected to have one but when I found one for about half debut price I couldn't help myself. So glad I got it! I was in a 1600x which was a great cpu also, probably more than enough but this renders video so well it worth it for that alone but I haven't been able to slow this thing down. As far as games this just muscles right through them running Crossfired RX 580's and a Crosshair VI Hero WiFi AC. This was a good deal at launch and now the price is amazingly low, Get One!!
customer_reviews.author: Kastia F

customer_reviews.title: Good processor just one issue with the processor gives me ...
customer_reviews.text: Good processor just one issue with the processor gives me a bit of pause how this was overlooked. This processor had a bin number of 1724sus and has a known issue with Compiler Segmentation Fault Issue here is the story and its a fact AMD is replacing all those affected. So in short anything after 1725 or week 25 is not affected by the compiler issue. anything on or before 1725 is affected by what i can see. So now I must wait 2 weeks for my CPU to be returned to me from AMD after an RMA Thanks amazon for not alerting customers of this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU. I never had a AMD build before so i took a shot at it. Everything is smooth as far as work flow and gaming. My only issue is I can only Overclock it to 3.9 HZ but not a deal break. Anyone who buys a ryzen just make sure you download the chipset from AMD site so you get Ryzen Master software and AMD Ryzen Balance Power Option. Makes a different in performance.
customer_reviews.author: Eternal

customer_reviews.title: Easy install great gpu
customer_reviews.text: Great operating system my computer runs super smooth never any hiccups was easy to install and would recommend this gpu to any one
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Great little chip for the money.
customer_reviews.text: This was great value for the money at the time I bought it. It handled everything I asked of it without really breaking a sweat. Gaming it got decent numbers while paired with a RX 480 and then a GTX 1060. I never had this thing come close to thermal shutdown or voltage issues. Mine however was part of the segfault group and I ended up selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Daryl J. Shippee

customer_reviews.title: Love this cpu!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using the 1800x since September and have noticed no difference from an Intel chip. Ryzen did a great job with this chip set considering I'm a fan of Intel over amd but I am editing large video files and compression times are generally better with this cpu. If you're only planning to game I still would go with an Intel but amazing cpu overall.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Speed's be Ryzen!!
customer_reviews.text: Best pc processor I have ever purchased. I bought the 1800x instead of the Intel 7700K after previously being pretty much 100% intel since the 8088 days. I will be purchasing AMD Ryzen procs for new/future builds as well
customer_reviews.author: Charles Frady

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: This multi-tasker can do anything you want it to! I am super stoked to have bought it for 260$ instead of the original 500. Look no further!
customer_reviews.author: Volht

customer_reviews.title: Damn nice processor
customer_reviews.text: damn nice processor... good, fast, and powerfull!! only problem i had was one of the pins were bent so system would not turn on... took a while before i finally took the heat sink off and checked the processor. lucky for me i was able to bend it back enough to work. now its running just fine! using an AMD Wraith cooler. Update with photos. . . great lil processor and stays nice and cool with an older AMD air cooler. temp range from 75F to 122F or around 25C to 50C
customer_reviews.author: Edzew Kurai

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to play minefield and watch porn. It does that
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Great processor. I would highly recommend this cpu if ...
customer_reviews.text: Great processor. I would highly recommend this cpu if you are considering a new build, and are looking at something like the better i7's. It's right up there with them at like half of the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Significantly improved my photo editing time
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor. Significant improvement over my FX-8450 processor. I do photo editing as a hobby and I and extremely glad AMD developed this!! This CPU has helped greatly with the time it takes to process big images and perform complex Photoshop routines (merging, in particular).
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for game development
customer_reviews.text: I use the cpu for game development with unreal engine 4 because of the 8 cores and cache. It preforms better than I ever imagined and is unbelievably quick. Paired with a 1080ti , 32 gigs of ram, and all liquid cooled this is the best performing PC I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better price and performance than any intel CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing processor. It has more power than I will ever use but I purchased it when it was on sale. I have it in a Asus Rog b350f board with cooler master hyper cooler evolution 212. It comes with AM4 mounts. 16gb 3400mhz gskill trident Ram Samsung m.2 256gb pro. In a Roswill nautilus case. And only an RX 460 Rog GPU until prices come down or I find a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice: ) Obviously it's not the very best ...
customer_reviews.text: It's been nearly a year since I bought this CPU. There were some growing pains at first but everything seems to be running optimally now. The CPU idles at 28c on air in my rig. Pretty nice :) Obviously it's not the very best for PC gaming but it does a great job. I run 2560x1440 on 144hz coupled with a vega64 and get over 100fps in all titles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 2 ssd this is easily the best bang for the buck workstation processor you ...
customer_reviews.text: Huge upgrade coming from an 8350. Paired with 3200 mhz ram and an m.2 ssd this is easily the best bang for the buck workstation processor you can possibly buy.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: You know what's up when it's all good.
customer_reviews.text: Oh baby, I can't wait to use this for my music production build. I'm gonna load up so many instances of plugins. It's gonna get scroooooooeeeechin up in here y'all. Come down to big dj daddy house and I'll woop you a juice of some classic trance beats. Come into my house and we'll settle a time to do a collaboration deal.
customer_reviews.author: Olufemi Williams

customer_reviews.title: I like it just fine
customer_reviews.text: I like it just fine. It does what it's supposed to, but it reports temperatures 30 C higher than they actually are which is stupid
customer_reviews.author: Michael Willman

customer_reviews.title: So FAST!
customer_reviews.text: HOLY. CRAP. This is so fast, it has everything I need as a gamer, programmer, superuser, and networking tech. It runs so smoothly and it cant be over stated how insanely fast this is.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: awesome with the correct memory
customer_reviews.text: cant write anything to do it justice with g.skill flare memory, corsair mp500 m.2 pcie ssd, firecuda hdd and my 2 time proven r9 290x's my computer rocks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Holy smokes!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded my computer from the FX-8350. What a difference. I thought I was happy with the 8350 but didn't realize how slow my computer was until I upgraded. Minimum of 60FPS on every game I own on highest settings (combined with a GTX 1080)
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Benchmark exceeds comparable Intel CPU
customer_reviews.text: We build both Intel and AMD gaming machines. For this price, the Ryzen beats the comparable Intel CPU. I use the 1800X for my personal machine using MSI Gaming Pro Carbon mobo. Prices are fluctuating on the 1800X atm. Ryzen vs Intel comparison Intel Core i7-7700 vs AMD Ryzen 7 1800X Userbenchmark Effective CPU Speed: 86.6% vs 92.9% Intel Core i7-7700 - 32nd / 980 AMD Ryzen 7 1800X - 21st / 980
customer_reviews.author: Dr C.

customer_reviews.title: CPU To Get
customer_reviews.text: If you use a AMD CPU and looking to get more power within a budget, you will not be disappointed. She is faster and more then worth the extra dollars to get a CPU that will do what you need with the power to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Robert A. Westerman

customer_reviews.title: AMD makes a comeback in a big way
customer_reviews.text: After the Phenom fiasco, followed-up by the lackluster Bulldozer, this is AMD smacking a sharp, extra-base hit. AMD is back in the game!
customer_reviews.author: Rainys A. Blekaitis

customer_reviews.title: AMD Ryzen 7 1800X Processor (YD180XBCAEWOF)
customer_reviews.text: Top of the tippy top for me at least, for the price i seen the cup go for more in other site or stores.... performance great👍🏼 and easy to install..
customer_reviews.author: Rom3

customer_reviews.title: Work and Play all in one.
customer_reviews.text: I am a indie dev with a liking for gaming. This performance in rendering is AMAZING as well as decent at gaming. If you are wanting to ONLY game, grab a high end i5 or i7. If you work or render AT ALL and want to still game like a boss... this is your bread and butter.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Elms

customer_reviews.title: best bang for buck for my video editing computer
customer_reviews.text: Super fast processor and great price! Amazon consistently had the price down lower than any other stores for some time, so I have decided to snag one for myself and created a brand new computer rig for video editing. Couldn't be more happy with the price and performance
customer_reviews.author: raWr Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the Ryzen 1800. For the money you can't beat this. If your a gamer, get this instead of Intel and save your money for a headset, mouse, and keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Bo

customer_reviews.title: Yes
customer_reviews.text: Sweet sweet loving...what's not to like? You can find thorough reviews everywhere, so I'll just say that mine installed easily and runs beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great processor and works great
customer_reviews.text: Great processor and works great. Its performance is equal to the 1700x in most respects. Its multitasking is a bit smoother though.
customer_reviews.author: Longinius

customer_reviews.title: Best Value!
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the price, probably the best value you can get. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: P and A Alter

customer_reviews.title: Good CPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a new build. Works great. Will get hot if not properly cooled. Using a corsair h100 for cooling. CPU works great. No issues. AMD did good this time around
customer_reviews.author: Drewster

customer_reviews.title: runs great performance seems to keep up with my old 8350
customer_reviews.text: runs great performance seems to keep up with my old 8350. Still testing it out and seeing what it can do but so far I haven't had a single hiccup yet!
customer_reviews.author: Robin Brodowsky

customer_reviews.title: Fast, fast, fast
customer_reviews.text: Talk about an upgrade, an amazing CPU that I just cant wrap my head around. Great for an upgrade, watch for sales and it can be a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Draggard Arcane

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to upgrade my system for the upcoming Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020. Plugged it in with a little thermal grease, and its taking charge. I also do a lot of aviation photo editing and this processor I'm very happy with the purchase. It works as advertised. I had a Ryzen 3 1200 and this is a huge improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Mw

customer_reviews.title: Great performance right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: Loved how this worked great right out of the box. Easy overclock with mobo that supports it and speeds are great! AMD definitely brought it back over the last year. Also love the amount of support and updates AMD has been doing with the mobo manufacturers to get bios and everything more streamline!
customer_reviews.author: buddy burlison

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat this CPU for the price
customer_reviews.text: Been using it for gaming and work. Powerful and runs cool. Can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: SaltySteel

customer_reviews.title: Price - Performance Redefined "Blue" Monopoly Finished!
customer_reviews.text: My First and Last AMD CPU(2010 - 2014) was the Phenom II 965 i have both revision versions(C2 and C3) the premise was "Price - Performance" so im glad to back again whit the same reasons i buy the phenom back them. Welcome Back AMD!
customer_reviews.author: PCPanamaCrew

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cpu.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic cpu, tears through video work and performs very well in gaming also. AMD have hit a homerun with the ryzen line.
customer_reviews.author: S. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Spring for the 1700 or 1700x if you want a cheaper price for similar performance with overclocking
customer_reviews.text: The 1800x pairs great with a gtx 1080ti for almost anything. From 4k editing to maxed out gaming
customer_reviews.author: Markus

customer_reviews.title: This processor is way ahead of the competition with a great value for money
customer_reviews.text: Great processor, amazing value for money. It runs everything with low cpu usage. I won't need to care about cpu upgrades in a long time. I'm using it with a gigabyte a320m-s2h motherboard (I don't overclock) and it runs smoothly out of the box, even with an outdated BIOS version. I'm playing battlefield 1 with 35% CPU usage, it feels great.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: Fast Processor For The Money
customer_reviews.text: This processor is fast! I like it a lot! The install was not great though. I was not aware that Ryzen 7 was not compatible with windows 7 and it made the installation process tedious. Great value for the money and great processsor!
customer_reviews.author: Narwhal

customer_reviews.title: Great cpu for multitasking.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to do any video rendering but so far for gaming and multitasking, this cpu is barely noticing. The temperatures are 32C normally and I have nothing negative to say about it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerhouse!
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this CPU wouldn't handle RSI Star Citizen, PUBG, Overwatch. WRONG... This CPU doesn't even get over 60%... I will say, having 32G of RAM really allows this CPU to Shine. I would think 16g of RAM is minimum nowadays since everything is RAM hungry. Great Product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: Just great really helped my vr performance Does run warm with that cooler I ordered a water cooler so we will see if it’s better then.
customer_reviews.author: Erick Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: No issues with any AAA games or high part count CAD.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Schroen

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream using premiere pro
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this processor for over a year now mainly for editing 4K video from my Sony A7rii and DJI Inspire 1. Works like a dream using premiere pro, after effects, photoshop and Lightroom. Thank you AMD and Ryzen!
customer_reviews.author: colby johnson

customer_reviews.title: Happy gaming rig
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my X370 pro. Fast with no drama after updating windows 10.
customer_reviews.author: Hot Tub Lover

customer_reviews.title: AMD just made the real comeback, this chip simply ...
customer_reviews.text: AMD just made the real comeback, this chip simply works flawless and at low temps in a liquid cooled system. 77 degrees f. on heavy load 80
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent processor! love the performance I'm getting on it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent processor! love the performance I'm getting on it.Mounted it on a ROG Crosshair VI Extreme (before the latest Nvidia crap!)
customer_reviews.author: Gil M. Levesque
